Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c The time slots for signing works like a charm. I moved them to 2 seconds as I had problems with 1 second.And I have made 3 withdraws in same block, they have been processed one by one without problem.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: good to hear!

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @SHossain You can try multiple withdraw now!

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what is multiple withdraw?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ah, nothins special. Creating withdrwas in same block and to see if they are going to be processed one by one.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: As withdraws at the same time cannot be done, because of utxos that are not spent until sign i completed. But that could also be optimized...

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Ah I see the issue there

Author: Alright#0419
Content: had a thought last night about withdraws. Have you considered just how large of a tx there will be with 15 sigs?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or 13, whatever it is

Author: Alright#0419
Content: on BTC, that might be a pretty significant fee

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Well yes, it will be more fee. But it wont be 13, it will be 7 (7of13)

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But still larger than regular tx.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: does the gateway consolidate utxos at all?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: i'll compile latest and try now

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: It was, but I removed it recently as it was making a problem. But as there will be rewards claiming for KMD external chain, that process will consolidate utxos.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: let's say there are 10 BTC utxos in the gateway, combining these 10 for a withdraw with 7 sigs for each will create a massive tx

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, definitely it will be some higher fee with big txs.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c BTW, initially txfee was hardcoded to 20k sats for BTC I think. We should see how this should change overtime if at some point txfees rise, we would not get the tx confirmed long time if it is lower fee.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: We should definitely first use txfee per byte

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: correct, maybe use the BTC adaptive fee estimator

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But then if fee is high we should be able to adjust it
